result.execSummary:
All charges against Kristi Melinda David in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristi Melinda David is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristi Melinda David

defendant.name: David, Kristi Melinda

records.addlTxt:
- AMENDED 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

 - It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Aaron K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

3:45 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kristi Melinda David in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kristi Melinda David.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF30, 22CF103, 22CF115, & 22CF141.  ADA Smestad recites joint recommendation to DJOC on Ct 1 in 22CF30 and plea to Ct 5 in 22CF30.  Shelby Hilden from JSC is here in person and states DE's been testing since March and tests have been negative.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine and Ct 5- Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 22CF30. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 & 5 in 22CF30.  Court withholds sentencing in favor of DJOC for 2 years on Ct 1 in 22CF30, Staff from Diversion Agreement to provide quarterly updates. Court adds JSC balance of $433.60 to Diversion agreement.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2-4 in 22CF30, Court out right dismisses 22CF103, 22CF115, & 22CF141. Sentencing arguments. Court amends bond to signature bond.  

Court Orders: Ct 5 in 22CF30

S/W 1 Year Probation

- Court Costs: $243.00     
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00
Pay through Probation.  Bond on file to be returned to payor. 

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Maintain Absolute sobriety
- Maintain Mental health and treatment programs 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by tomorrow, 10/19/22 by 4:00 PM

Court notes 6 days credit against ultimate sentence

Adjourned at 4:21 PM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant's Request for Rescheduled 12/19 Court Date. Filed by Atty. Dolfi. kma   

Per SRN, approved. JA will schedule. kma
Final pre-trial on December 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury trial on February 1, 2023 at 08:00 am.

2:09 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Kristi Melinda David in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kristi Melinda David.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF30, 22CF103, 22CF115, & 22CF141.  Court reviews file.  Atty Dolfi states there is not a resolution at this time.  Court schedules trial.  If an agreement is reached, parties to reach out to JA to schedule PLEAS earlier than December.  Off record DE confirmed address and phone number. Adjourned 2:16 PM. bph
Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:52 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Attorney Ericka Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Kristi Melinda David. Defendant Kristi Melinda David appeared by video. Includes 22CF30 (STC), 22CF103 (ARGN), 22CF115 (ARGN), & 22CF141 (STC).  Court reviews files, DE did not have permission to appear via zoom today but will allow it.  On 22CF103 & 22CF115- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on all counts. Ms. Sitz states DE has been testing negative.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues.  Atty Dolfi asking to suspend testing at JSC.  Court will suspend testing for this week, to recommence next week. Adjourned at 11:10 AM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

JA received phone call from Def. indicating she was released from the E.R. over the weekend and will not be able to appear in person for today's hearings. She also indicated she emailed her attorney on 7/10/22. JA provided her the PD Office's phone number and instructed her to call them as well. RJG
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km           to js
Per SRN. bph
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NG on both counts.  State to provide discovery within a week.  Court will cancel May date and push next date out.  DE to test today, which will take care of testing for the week. INCLUDES: 22CF30, 22CF103 & 22CF115, 22CF139, & 22CF141 .

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing random ETG testing at least 1 time per week.  If DE's case worker is willing to test her, case worker is to provide any miss testing or positive tests to JSC. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

 - It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Aaron K.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

03:34 PM   Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy  ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Kristi Melinda David appeared.  INCLUDES: ARGN for 22CF30 & Initial for 22CF103 & 22CF115.   
22CF30: Information has been filed.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Court will set PTC w/ SRN.   
22CF103:  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.      
22CF115:   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. 

Atty Dolfi requests no contact provision changed to no abusive contact or phone contact from current the bond.  State does not object to phone contact.  Court will allow telephone contact.  
Adjourned: 3:47  22CF30: Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.  22CF103 & 22CF115: Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

INCLUDES: 22CF30, 22CF103 & 22CF115

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing random ETG testing at least 1 time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Aaron K. with the exception of telephone communication with Aaron K.    The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Preliminary hearing on March 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2022 at 11:15 am.
